intro: Hebenstretia bequaertii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows to a height of about 30 cm, characterized by its upright stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals, and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to care for.
